verses.text: When Israel went out of Egypt, The house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
Judah was his sanctuary, \add And\add* Israel his dominion.
The sea saw \add it\add*, and fled: Jordan was driven back.
The mountains skipped like rams, \add And\add* the little hills like lambs.
What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? Thou Jordan, \add that\add* thou wast driven back?
Ye mountains, \add that\add* ye skipped like rams; \add And\add* ye little hills, like lambs?
Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, At the presence of the God of Jacob;
Which turned the rock \add into\add* a standing water, The flint into a fountain of waters.
